question: Question_A_23
sols:
The probability of moving from location $\displaystyle i$ to location
$\displaystyle 2$ in $\displaystyle 10$ time steps is
$\displaystyle (P^{10})_{2,i}$. We know
$\displaystyle (P^{10})_{2,1} = 0.3843$,
$\displaystyle (P^{10})_{2,2} = 0.3753$, and
$\displaystyle (P^{10})_{2,3} = 0.3786$, so to maximize the probability
of getting to location 2, you should start from location 1.
hints:

$\displaystyle j$ in $\displaystyle k$ time steps is
$\displaystyle (P^k)_{j,i}$.
